        public java.awt.Color getColor()

      • getCountry

        public Country getCountry()
        Gets the Country object this Player currently resides in. If the player has arrived on its current position, the city it travelled to determines its country. Otherwise, the country is determined based on the city the player came from.
        Returns:

      • getCountryFrom

        public Country getCountryFrom()
        Gets the Country object this Player currently resides in. If the player has arrived on its current position, the city it travelled to determines its country. Otherwise, the country is determined based on the city the player came from.
        Returns:

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this player (sets its money back to 0).

      • setPendingPosition

        public void setPendingPosition(Position pending)
        Sets the pending position of this GUI Player. That is, the player will attempt to move to the pending position after finishing its current travel. This gives a more responsive design.
        Parameters:
        pending - The pending position.

      • setPosition

        public void setPosition(Position newPos)
        Sets the position of this Player instance. Only has effect, if the Player has arrived to its destination, or the game has just started.
        Parameters:
        newPos - The new position to attempt to move this Player to.

      • step

        public void step()
        Advances this Player one step.

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(City c)
        Attemps to travel to the given city. A player can only travel towards the new city if it is not currently travelling (and is connected directly to the given city). If currently travelling, the city is placed on 'pending'. Can also turn around the current position, if 'from' is parsed as argument.
        Parameters:
        c - The city to attempt to travel to.

      • turnAround

        public void turnAround()
        Turns around this Player (travels towards 'from' instead of 'to').
